text: A few of the main characters from My Hero Academia. From left to right: Tenya "Ingenium" Iida, Ochako "Uravity" Uraraka, Izuku "Deku" Midoriya, Katsuki "Kacchan" Bakugo, and Shōto Todoroki. The My Hero Academia manga and anime series features a vast world with an extensive cast of characters created by Kōhei Horikoshi. The series takes place in a fictional world where, currently, more than 80% of the Earth's population possesses some form of superhuman ability, commonly referred to as a "Quirk" the advent of these abilities has given rise to not only professional heroes, but also the threat of villains. ==U.A. High School students== ===Class 1-A students=== ; / : :The main protagonist of the series. After attempting to save Bakugō from a villain, Izuku, an initially Quirkless boy, is chosen by All Might to become the ninth holder of , a Quirk that can be passed on between others that also stockpiles the user's physical strength and unleashes it as a powerful burst. Eventually, Izuku finds out that One for All contains the quirks of the previous users. ; : : Katsuki is Izuku's childhood friend turned arch-rival and classmate in Class 1-A. Despite bullying Izuku in the past, over the course of the series he grows to care for Izuku's well-being, especially as Izuku's power grows. He possesses the Quirk giving his sweat nitroglycerin-like properties at which he can detonate at will. ; / : : A student in Class 1-A. His Quirk is , which allows him to generate ice from the right side of his body and fire from the left. He is the youngest child of Endeavor. ; / : : A girl whose Quirk which allows her to make any object she touches with all five of her fingers on one hand to become weightless. She harbors romantic feelings towards Izuku, though she is willing to temporarily put her feelings aside to focus on her hero work. ; / : : The serious Class Representative whose Quirk is which gives him super-speed via jet engines in his legs. After his older brother Tensei is forced to retire due to being critically injured by Stain, Tenya decides to take up his brother's hero name. ; / : : A student in Class 1-A whose Quirk allows him to harden his body. He suffers from self-confidence issues, looking up to fellow heroes Mina Ashido and Izuku Midoriya. ; / : : A girl in Class 1-A. Her Quirk gives her abilities such as enhanced swimming and a long, prehensile tongue. ; / : : A student of Class 1-A, whose Quirk is , giving her the ability to create any non-biological object from the lipids stored in her body as long as she knows its molecular structure. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk grows many small, highly adhesive balls on his head that he can remove and use as weapons. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk allows him to absorb and emit electricity at the cost of causing his brain to short circuit. ; / : ; Chrissy Costanza (singing, both languages) : A girl in Class 1-A whose Quirk which allows her to plug her extremely long earlobes into objects to listen to sounds or transmit the sound of her own heartbeat. During the U.A. School Festival, Kyoka was the lead singer for Class 1-A's performance. ; / : : A student in 1-A whose Quirk gives him control of a sentient shadow that grows more powerful with darkness. ; / : : A girl in Class 1-A whose Quirk allows her to excrete an acidic fluid from her body. As a middle schooler, she chased away a giant villain threatening her friends while Eijiro Kirishima stood paralyzed with fear. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk is which allows him to fire a laser blast from his belly button. He feels a sense of kinship with Izuku due to both of their quirks causing themselves bodily harm. ; / : : A student whose Quirk allows him to grow individual body organs at the tips of four webbed tentacles growing from his shoulders. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk allows him to shoot cellophane tape from his tape dispenser-like elbows. ; / : : A student whose Quirk grants him a thick prehensile tail. ; / : : A student whose Quirk allows him to talk with animals. ; / : : A student in Class 1-A whose Quirk makes her entire body invisible, as well as giving her the ability to refract light. ; / : : A student whose Quirk gives him enhanced strength but less cognitive ability whenever he consumes sugar. ===Class 1-B students=== ; / : : A student whose Quirk allows him to temporarily use a Quirk after touching its user. For unknown reasons, he harbors an intense dislike of Class 1-A. ; / : : The Class Representative of Class 1-B whose Quirk allows Itsuka to enlarge her fists. ; / : : A girl whose Quirk allows Ibara to grow vines from her hair that she can extend and use in combat. ; / : : A student whose Quirk allows Tetsutetsu to temporarily turn his skin into steel. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk enables him to soften anything that he touches. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk allows him to, at the site of an initial impact, create a second impact. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk allows him to physically connect anything he makes contact with. ; : : A boy whose Quirk enables him to solidify air into a wall or platform. ; / : : A student whose Quirk allows him to rotate any part of his body at incredibly high speeds, similarly to a drill. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk enables him to excrete a glue- like liquid from seven "eyeholes" on his glue dispenser-like head.. ; / : : A girl whose Quirk grants her the ability to telekinetically manipulate objects around her. ; / : : A student whose Quirk grants him the ability to transform into a monstrous beast. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk grants him the ability to merge into anything that is black-colored and control it. ; / : : A girl whose Quirk enables her to change the size of any object she interacts with. ; / : : A boy whose Quirk enables him to form scales on his body for combat and other purposes. ; / : : A girl whose Quirk grants her the ability to create spores from her cells, allowing her to grow mushrooms from the surfaces of her surroundings. ; / : : A student whose Quirk , grants him the ability to produce large, sharp blades from all over his body. ; : : A girl whose Quirk allows her to effectively fire horns on her head and control them. ; / : : A girl whose Quirk allows her to split her body into several pieces and control them telekinetically. ; / : : A student whose Quirk allows him to manifest different onomatopoeias into reality in the form of katakana. ===Third Year students=== ; / : : Mirio is one of the three top students in U.A. His former Quirk allowed him to phase his body through anything solid, including the ground itself. He lost his quirk during the Kai Chisaki raid mission. ; / : : One of the three top students in U.A., whose Quirk gives him the properties and abilities of anything he eats. ; / : : One of the three top students in U.A., who can generate spiral-like shockwaves with her Quirk . ===Other students=== ; : : Mei is a student from the Support Course whose Quirk is , which allows her to zoom her vision to up to 5 kilometers. ; : : Hitoshi is a student from the General Course who is eventually accepted into the Hero Course. His Quirk is , which allows him to control those who answer his questions. ==Pro Heroes== ===Top Heroes=== ; / : : A Hero with immense flame powers from his Quirk who is the father of Shoto and his three older siblings. While in the past, he had a strained relationship with his children, though he later tries to fix it after becoming the number 1 hero. ; / : : A young Pro Hero, whose Quirk is which grants him a pair of red feathered wings that allow him to fly, as well as the ability to manipulate detached feathers from a distance. He infiltrates the Paranormal Liberation Front as a double agent. After being discovered to be a traitor, he is severely burned by Dabi, but is later rescued by Tokoyami. ; / : : A hero who has the Quirk , allowing him to control the fibers in clothes. He is seemingly killed by Hawks in order to gain the trust of the League of Villains. ; / : : A hero whose Quirk enables him to manipulate the thinness of his body. ; / : : A young woman whose Quirk gives her rabbit like features such as enhanced leg strength and big rabbit- like ears. She is heavily wounded by several Nomus after the raid on Jaku Hospital, including losing an arm and a leg. ; / : : A Hero who whose Quirk gives him the ability to manipulate his tree-like limbs. ; / : : A hero who takes Nejire Hado, Ochaco Uraraka, and Tsuyu Asui as her interns. Her Quirk enables her to turn into a european dragon. ===Faculty of U.A.=== ; / : : The eighth user of One For All, he is referred to by many as the . Due to the crippling injury he sustained from fighting All For One in the past, he ultimately selects Izuku as his successor. In his rematch with All For One, All Might lost the ability to use On For All completely. ; : : The principal of U.A. and one of a few non-human animals to develop a Quirk. His Quirk is , which allows him to have anthropomorphic abilities and extreme intelligence. ; / : : Class 1-A's home teacher whose Quirk allows him to nullify others' Quirks within his sight until he blinks. ; / : : The school's English teacher whose Quirk amplifies his voice. In the anime, Present Mic occasionally breaks the fourth wall by explaining a character's Quirk. ; / : : The homeroom teacher for Class 1-B. His Quirk is , which allows him to control his blood after it leaves his body. ; / : : The elderly school nurse whose Quirk is , allowing her to heal others' injuries by kissing them. ; / : : A Pro Heroine and teacher at U.A. whose Quirk allows her to produce a sleep-inducing fragrance from her body. ; / : : A Pro Hero and teacher at U.A. whose Quirk allows him to control concrete. ; : : A Pro Hero and teacher at U.A. whose Quirk summons a black hole with her fingers that turns anything it sucks in into dust. ; : : A pro hero and teacher at U.A.whose Quirk allows him to spew out ectoplasm that can form into a clone of himself. ; : : A Pro Hero and teacher at U.A. whose Quirk allows him to alter the trajectory of his bullets. ===The Wild Wild Pussycats=== ; / : :A member of the Pussycats whose Quirk allows her to advise and instruct multiple people at once through mental transmission. ; / : :A member of the Pussycats whose former Quirk allows her to observe and monitor up to 100 people at a time. After her Quirk is stolen by All For One offscreen, she remains a part of the team and is now taking care of the office duties. ; / : :The only male member of the Pussycats. His Quirk allows him to stretch and bend his body. ; / : :A member of the Pussycats whose Quirk allows her to freely manipulate earth. ===Other Heroes=== ; / : : A rookie Heroine whose Quirk allows her to grow significantly. Mt. Lady was originally conceived by Kōhei Horikoshi to be the female lead, but was replaced by Ochaco due to not knowing how to utilize her quirk in the story. Compared to other Pro Heroes, she is much more flamboyant and less mature, but is willing to take her work seriously when needed. ; / : : A retired hero whose Quirk allows him to shoot air through the soles of his feet. Elements of Sorahiko's character are based on Yoda. ; / : : A Pro Hero whose Quirk gives him the abilities and appearance of a killer whale which he can use in the water or land. ; / : : A Pro Hero and former sidekick to All Might whose Quirk , allows him to see a person's future. Nighteye is fatally wounded by Overhaul during the Shie Hassaikai raid, and later dies in the hospital. ; / : : A Pro Hero who employed Tamaki Amajiki and Eijiro Kirishima for their internships. His Quirk allows him to absorb the impact from collisions. ; / : : A Pro Hero whose Quirk enables him to lock any non-living item in a position. ; / : : A Pro Hero whose unnamed quirk allows him to control water. ==Paranormal Liberation Front== ; : :The main antagonist of the series. Born , he is the grandson of All Might's mentor Nana Shimura who became All for One's apprentice after he accidentally murdered his family when his touch-based Quirk which allows him to destroy whatever he grabs with his hand, manifested. After an experimental treatment by Dr. Garaki, Tomura now wields the original quirk All For One. ; : : All Might's nemesis and one of the first Quirk users, his Quirk allows him to both steal and bestow Quirks. ; : : Tomura's caretaker and the League's second-in command, who wields the portal-based Quirk . He is later revealed to be a Nomu created from the corpse of Aizawa's classmate . ; : : A scientist who creates the Nomus and served as All for One's personal doctor, possessing a longevity Quirk that makes him appear years younger than he really is. The character's name was previously , but was changed following the backlash in relation to the war crimes committed by Unit 731. ; : : A kaiju-sized Villain who is All For One's bodyguard and secret weapon, possessing multiple Quirks. ; / : : A broker working for the League of Villains whose Quirk allows him to make someone's memories of recent events vague after making contact with their head. ; : : A youth whose real name is unknown. His unnamed Quirk allows him to generate and control blue fire. ; : : A girl whose Quirk allows her to assume the appearance of anyone whose blood she ingests. ; / : : A man whose Quirk allows him to create copies of anything he touches, including himself. He is fatally wounded by Hawks during the war between Heroes and Villains. ; / : : A villain whose Quirk allows him to "compress" anything in a spherical area into a small marble without actually damaging it. He lost his left arm during the initial meeting with Overhaul and it was replaced with a cybernetic one. ; / : : A villain whose Quirk gives him a lizard-like appearance and abilities. ; / : : A transgender woman whose Quirk allows her to magnetize others within an area around herself. She is later killed by Overhaul. ; : : A villain whose Quirk allows him to augment the muscle fibers that are beneath his skin. ; / : A leading member of the former Meta Liberation Army whose Quirk grants him the ability to convert stress and anger to increase his strength and size: ; / : A leading member of the former Meta Liberation Army whose Quirk allows him to boost the morale and physical status of his subordinates from his voice. ; / : A leading member of the former Meta Liberation Army whose Quirk allows him to take a human-sized object and turn it into an exact lookalike of any given person. ; : A member of the former Meta Liberation Army whose unnamed quirk allows him to freely manipulate nearby ice. ==Other Villains== ; / : : A former hero who became disillusioned with how many became heroes for fame, becoming a serial killer who targets those he deems unworthy to be heroes. His Quirk is where he ingests a blood sample of his opponent to paralyze them for a length of time. ; / : : The current leader of the Shie Hassaikai yakuza gang and the foster child of the unnamed former boss. As the leader of the Shie Hassaiki, he amassed followers by recruiting people who were abandoned by society. His Quirk enables him to use his arms to manipulate matter, either to disassemble or absorb others. ; / : : Danjuro is a villain who commits crimes for the sake of fame through video recordings of his criminal acts. His Quirk allows him to bestow the property of elasticity to anything he touches. ; / : : Gentle's loyal fan and admirer, helping him gain infamy by filming and uploading his criminal activities online. Manami's Quirk allows her to boost the power of whomever she loves the most by declaring her love to them ==Other Hero Schools== ===Shiketsu High School=== ; / : : A first year student whose Quirk allows him to control the wind. ; / : : A second year student whose Quirk allows her to create illusions. ; / : : A student from Shiketsu High whose Quirk allows him to mold others into restrained globs of flesh. ==Other characters== ; : : Izuku's mother. Initially supportive of her son's dreams, the constant villain attacks on U.A. make her briefly doubt the safety of the school. ; : : Tsukauchi is a detective who is All Might's client in the Police Force, therefore knowing of his and Izuku's Quirk. ; : : A young boy who lost his Hero parents, the Water Hose duo, to Muscular, and was taken in by the Pussycats due to Mandalay being his aunt. ; : : Eri is the granndaughter of the unnamed former boss of the Shie Hassaikai and adopted daughter of Chisaki, who used her blood in order to create "Quirk-destroying bullets." Her Quirk allows her to bring an individual's body to a previous state. After being saved from Chisaki, Eri is taken into the care and protection of U.A. High School. ==Vigilantes spin-off== ; / : A 19–year old college student whose Quirk allows him to quickly travel across any flat surface. He became a vigilante after being unable to become a Pro Hero. ; / : A high schooler whose Quirk allows her to jump several meters high. She was briefly possessed by a villain known as Queen Bee, though she is saved from possession after she is shot through the chest, becoming heavily injured but alive. ; / / : An old man who is investigating the trafficking of a mysterious drug around town in order to find his daughter. His tenacity in battle makes others believe he possesses a Quirk related to physical prowess, when he actually has no Quirk at all. ==References== My Hero Academia
